definitions.definition: To tend steadily upward or downward.
examples: The road slopes sharply down at that point.

definitions.definition: To form with a slope; to give an oblique or slanting direction to; to incline or slant.
examples: to slope the ground in a garden;   to slope a piece of cloth in cutting a garment
I sloped in through the back door, hoping my boss wouldn't see me.
definitions.label_groups: UK , colloquial , usually followed by a preposition

definitions.definition: To hold a rifle at a slope with forearm perpendicular to the body in front holding the butt, the rifle resting on the shoulder.
examples: The order was given to " slope arms".

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To tend steadily upward or downward.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To form with a slope; to give an oblique or slanting direction to; to incline or slant.
( UK , colloquial , usually followed by a preposition ) To try to move surreptitiously .
( military ) To hold a rifle at a slope with forearm perpendicular to the body in front holding the butt, the rifle resting on the shoulder.
